false_positive_details.claimed_issue: ensure_loaded! defined at wrong scope (module Backend level)
false_positive_details.actual_finding: Method is correctly defined in I18n's singleton class (class << self), not in module Backend. Droid misread the Ruby code structure.

false_positive_details.claimed_issue: I18n.fallbacks could be false/boolean causing NoMethodError
false_positive_details.actual_finding: Client-side JS I18n.fallbacks=false is irrelevant to server-side Ruby. Rails initializers always run before controllers, guaranteeing FallbackLocaleList is set.

droid_missed: String/Symbol locale normalization causing potential double-loading

summary: Droid performed poorly on this PR with 0% precision and recall. Both droid comments were false positives stemming from misunderstanding Ruby code structure and Rails initialization order. The golden comments correctly identified two real low-severity bugs: a thread-safety race condition in lazy initialization and a String/Symbol normalization issue. This PR had subtle concurrency and type-consistency issues that require deeper understanding of Ruby semantics.
